page.title: 15RELIGION_CHURCHES_
page.content: In our area there are churches of many denominations e.g.Roman Catholic, Salvation Army,Jehovah's Witnesses and Anglican.St.Margarets church in Tanfield Village which is an Anglican church is the fourth oldest church in Durham.The church was built in the year 900 a.d. and supposedly was found by an anonymous monk from Chester-Le-Street.The man that we collected this information from has been a vicar for only 6 months in St.Margarets.So far he has held 14 baptisms,3 weddings and 8 funerals.The oldest gravestone was set there in 1650 and St.Cuthbert's body was supposed to have disappeared here.The church has 8 bells and the oldest was constructed in 1920 just 2 years after the first World War.About 30 people take communion at St.Margarets every week.
